DOC.detailed_description: In observational study , seek determine whether marker hyperinsulinemia situation increase maternal insulin requirement would increase risk neonatal hypoglycemia . Mothers select grade III obesity , acanthosis nigricans ( surrogates chronic maternal hyperinsulinemia ) , invasive bacterial infection use corticosteroid within seven day delivery ( surrogates subacute insulin resistance ) , report consume high-glycemic index diet within 24 hour delivery physically inactive within 24 hour delivery ( condition could increase maternal insulin requirement close delivery ) . Based find risk neonatal hypoglycemia increase fivefold inactivity ( 95 % CI : 2-11 , P < 0.001 ) , 11-fold high-carbohydrate intake ( 95 % CI : 4-24 , P < 0.001 ) 329-fold risk factor ( 95 % CI : 32-3362 , P < 0.001 ) , next evaluate protocol combine exercise balance diet throughout pregnancy influence maternal neonatal outcome . One outcomes analyze neonatal hypoglycemia .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : recurrent early unexplained miscarriage Exclusion criterion : ( ) antiphospholipid antibody , ( ii ) second thirdtrimester loss , ( iii ) multiple pregnancy , ( iv ) anatomical abnormality could increase risk early miscarriage , ( iv ) condition require priori anticoagulation , ( v ) protocol violation .
